newsitem.title: CHINA: China insurer life premiums hit 4.0 bln yuan.
newsitem.headline: China insurer life premiums hit 4.0 bln yuan.

text.p: China's Ping An Insurance Co collected 4.0 billion yuan in life insurance premiums between January and August 6, the Financial News said on Thursday.
The company aimed to boost life insurance premium income to 6.0 billion yuan in 1996, it said but gave no comparative figures.
Life premium income was expected to hit 40 billion yuan in the year 2000, to account for 70 percent of overall premium income, it said.
Analysts say life insurance in China has enormous growth potential, with life premiums accounting for only about 0.03 percent of the country's Gross Domestic Product.
